item.title: EFS - Elastic File System
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki EC2 EFS - Elastic File System Moves EC2 to be closer to being stateless Implementation of NFSv4 EFS Filesystems can be mounted in Linux only Uses POSIX permissions, a standard understood by all linux systems Shared between many EC2 Instances Private service, via mount targets inside a VPC Mount targets must be present in each AZ that a VPC uses to provide high availability Mount targets are what the EC2 instances use to connect to the EFS Can be accessed from on-premises via VPN or DX General Purpose and Max I/O performance mode Max I/O is good for highly parallel services Bursting and Provisioned Throughput Modes Storage Classes Standard (default) Infrequent Access (lower cost) Lifecycle Policies can be used with classes Amazon EFS is a fully-managed service that makes it easy to set up and scale file storage in the Amazon Cloud.
